New Records: Tyler Herro set a franchise record with his 70th consecutive game with at least one made three-pointer
Key Match Events: Jaime Jaquez Jr. chipped in 20 points, including five crucial points in the final 1:03, to secure Miami's second consecutive win
The Heat capitalized on transition opportunities, outscoring the Jazz 17-7 in fast-break points and making key hustle plays in crunch time

The Jazz had trimmed the Heat's lead to 90-88 and successfully challenged a foul call on Walker Kessler, but after losing the ensuing jump ball, the Heat capitalized with a Jaquez three-pointer, giving Miami a five-point cushion with just over a minute to play
Pre-Game Insights: Kevin Love missed the game for personal reasons, but his emotional leadership has reportedly galvanized the team during Jimmy Butler's absence
Post-Match Reflections: The Jazz remain the league's worst team at protecting the ball, and their 17 turnovers on the night were costly
The Heat showed resilience after a blowout loss to Utah in the first game of Jimmy Butler's seven-game suspension
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz had injuries to key playersâ€”including Jordan Clarkson (foot), John Collins (hip), Keyonte George (heel), and Brice Sensabaugh
The Heat have steadily improved, narrowly losing in double overtime to Sacramento before notching back-to-back wins against Golden State and Utah
The Jazz's home losing streak extended to nine games
Others: The Heat (19-17) continue their road trip with a game against the Portland Trail Blazers on Saturday
The Jazz (9-27), looking to snap their losing streak, will face the Phoenix Suns in an afternoon matchup that same day
